data.title: Ghana Buries Kofi Annan, Hailed as Exceptional Global Leader
data.meta_description: Kofi Annan, the soft-spoken diplomat who served as the first United Nations secretary-general from sub-Saharan Africa and died Aug. 18 in Switzerland at the age of 80 after a short illness, was laid to rest in Ghana on Thursday.
data.text:
Annan was first UN Secretary-General from sub-Saharan Africa

Diplomat ‘brought renown to Ghana,’ President Akufo-Addo says

Kofi Annan , the soft-spoken diplomat who served as the first United Nations secretary-general from sub-Saharan Africa and died Aug. 18 in Switzerland at the age of 80 after a short illness, was laid to rest in Ghana on Thursday.

Annan was one of Ghana’s prominent public figures and his death triggered an outpouring of grief in the West African nation. More than 6,000 mourners attended his funeral at an auditorium in the capital, Accra, and many more gathered outside the venue where traditional drummers and dancers paid tribute.
